column4: anyone here who knows with which options (to configure) and which layout apache2 is compiled for ubuntu?
i wanted to compile it without that much modules builtin
read debian/rules of the source package for apache2
can you tell me the path to that file, please? i don't find it!
do you know how to obtain the source package for apache2?
oh, i'd obtained it from the apache website...
right but to get the source package for the .deb in ubuntu you would do  'apt-get source PACKAGE_NAME_HERE'

once you issue that command, you'll end up with a directory that starts with apache2*.  Inside you will find another directory called "debian" and inside that the "rules" file.  Note that you may need apache2-common's source package, I'm not sure
thank you, that should suffice for me! :)
np, the best way to do what you want (compile with less modules) is probably to edit the source package and then rebuild it.  See http://www.debian.org/doc/manuals/apt-howto/ch-sourcehandling.en.html
how do i build this source? 'apt-get build-dep apache2-2.0.55' doesn't work
apt-get build-dep PACKAGE_NAME  gets you the dependencies to build it.  Then you can use dpkg-buildpackage -rfakeroot -uc -b to build the deb
No i get "E: Unable to find a source package for apache2-2.0.55"
